result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Return date on December 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

8:33 AM Defendant DEVIN M SCHMITZ appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William Scott Nelson in court for DEVIN M SCHMITZ.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Atty Nelson states the defendant will be waiving his right to a prelim. Defendant concurs. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court and confirms it mirrors the criminal complaint. Attorney Kapelis acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Nelson enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set for Return Date December 19, 2022 at 10:30 AM. Traffic to track.

Court adjourned at 8:36 AM

No Contact with the victims listed in the complaint. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Preliminary hearing on October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am. / Instructions for How to Appear Remotely (confirmed with FDL Cty Jail)

No Contact with the victims listed in the complaint. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:00 AM Defendant DEVIN M SCHMITZ appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney William Scott Nelson appeared by video for DEVIN M SCHMITZ.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Atty Nelson confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and requests a preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. ADA makes bond recommendation. Atty Nelson makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $10,000 cash bond and conditions of: No Contact with the victims listed in the complaint. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.   Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant does not waive the time limits. 

Court adjourned at 9:04 AM.

Court will set for Preliminary Hearing on October 11, 2022 at 1:00 PM. 

Court enters NOT GUILTY plea with the traffic. Traffic will track.
